Gives George his own motel room and money to ensure he doesn't take the kids on his bike, showing care and responsibility.
Admits to George that she treated him badly and expresses that she misses him, showing vulnerability and sincerity.

Organizes safe accommodations and childcare for her kids during a difficult situation, asks a reluctant George for help, provides clear instructions and resources, acknowledges her own past mistakes and expresses gratitude and apology.
Admits to treating George badly and acknowledges her difficulties handling being liked by a nice person.
Smiles and shows openness and willingness to learn when George asks if she can learn to handle things better.
Expresses sincere concern for the community's health, stating she will get better but many others won't.
Visits Donna, who is fighting cancer, bringing release forms with sensitivity and respect for their situation.
Listens and empathizes with Donna and Pete's concerns about signing releases without pressuring them.
Says 'You know me. I pick things up real fast,' showing confidence in her ability to learn quickly.
Visits community members to personally get release forms signed despite their fears and mistrust, demonstrating initiative and skillful client engagement.
Acknowledges others' concerns and reluctance without pressuring, showing emotional intelligence and tact in difficult situations.
Gently encourages someone to reconsider signing without pressure, expressing understanding if they refuse.
Spends time personally visiting multiple plaintiffs in their homes, listening attentively and building trust.
Works late into the night organizing signed agreements while her children sleep, showing dedication and responsibility.
Gently takes the release form away from Matthew, wanting to shield him from harsh realities.
Explains to Matthew why she is helping the sick girl, showing care and hope for others.
Responds patiently and sincerely to her son's questions about the case.
Organizes and alphabetizes release forms late into the night, showing diligence and attention to detail.
Tries to shield her child from harsh realities of the case by gently redirecting him from reading the medical release form.
Manages to explain a complex and grim situation to her young son in an age-appropriate and hopeful way.
Forces herself awake in the early morning despite exhaustion to keep control of her car and work routines.
Smiles, moved by group's shift toward acceptance and warmly agrees to breakfast.
Greets a group of men arriving at work with a friendly 'Hey, y'all. How you all doing today?'
Engages warmly and personally with Mike Ambrosino by calling out and expressing eagerness to talk.
Focuses intensively on gathering signed release forms repeatedly and persistently, showing dedication but little overt personal warmth in shown actions.
Proactively approaches groups of people (men at firehouse, mothers at school) to distribute and collect release forms, increasing plaintiff participation.
Organizes and tracks signed release forms meticulously, noting steady growth in signed plaintiffs, demonstrating thoroughness and persistence.
Initiates contact with key individuals (e.g., Mike Ambrosino) by seeking them out actively to advance the case.
Eats cold eggs driving a dusty road, showing focus and determination by continuing work despite discomfort.
Immediately reacts with fear and hostility to a stranger blocking her, accusing him of threatening behavior.
Softens her stance when Charles Embry reveals information, gently pulls her arm away, and apologizes for not catching his name.
Listens attentively and asks questions about the documents and situation Embry describes.
Confronts a threatening stranger fearlessly and verbally challenges him despite initial fear.
Quickly realizes she misread the man's intentions and calmly shifts to a more measured, inquisitive approach, asking relevant questions.
Engages the man in conversation to gather potentially important information about document destruction related to PG&E.
Tries to hide her excitement upon learning about destroyed documents relevant to the case.
Plays down the seriousness of document destruction by casually wiping her mouth and sipping beer, maintaining calm in a tense situation.
Enters the room warmly greeting everyone with 'Morning!' and playfully interacts with Ed Potter about his birthday gift.
Presents a thoughtful, collective gift signed by many people to Ed Potter, showing consideration and gratitude.
Shares critical internal documents with the team and maintains an upbeat attitude despite the serious nature of the information.
Successfully gathers 635 signatures from clients, demonstrating thoroughness and persistence.
Obtains internal PG&E documents revealing company misconduct, showing resourcefulness and investigative skill.
Presents collected evidence confidently and with purpose, positively impacting her colleagues.
Uses humor and boldness to deflect tension in the office.
Engages in a friendly, sincere exchange with Ed, encouraging honesty and mutual respect.
Keeps her smile private, showing a reserved vulnerability during interaction with Ed.
Successfully obtains crucial evidence despite lacking formal legal expertise, using unconventional means and confident attitude.
Uses humor and sarcasm when describing her methods, demonstrating confidence and control of the situation.
Maintains composure and proud posture when others are in awe, showing self-assurance and capability.
Waves and is acknowledged by the family at the beach, engages gently in conversation with Donna, shares the good news about the settlement reassuringly.
Sits down beside Donna to discuss sensitive legal and personal matters, offers sincere reassurance about the financial settlement's positive impact.
Clearly explains the legal settlement details to Donna, showing understanding of the case and the judge's decision.
Comforts and reassures Donna about the financial settlement, demonstrating confidence and knowledge.
Pulls Donna close when she is overwhelmed, showing physical comfort and support.
Greets Rosalind warmly and makes light conversation to ease tension during unpacking.
Engages playfully with Ed, teasing about the office views in a friendly manner.
Comforts Donna who is overwhelmed by pulling her close.
Enters the new office, greets Rosalind with casual confidence.
Makes a humorous, confident remark to Ed about his office view.
Engages in a candid conversation with Ed about threat and extortion with calm and negotiation.
Reacts with surprise at the two million dollar check handed by Ed, indicating awareness of the firm's success.
Stares speechless at the offer, does not negotiate or challenge the bonus, showing reluctance or resignation.

Anna.Action: Refuses to help Erin, exasperated by her request.
